III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12502
Section • (1) An agency shall have and follow a current written
Description program statement that includes all the following
information:
• (b) Eligibility requirements for a youth, including age
and level of physical, emotional, and intellectual
functioning and youth not appropriate for the
program.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A has been using illegal substances such as cocaine, pills,
opioids, and marijuana. Youth A is also suicidal and has cuts all
over her arms from self-harming. Youth A reports having a plan for
suicide. Youth A also has stopped eating. There is a concern
regarding Youth A’s appropriateness for the program.
Investigation The Complainant was anonymous.
Chief Administrator (CA) was advised of the complaint via email
on May 7, 2024, and did not have additional information to add.
Program Manager (PM) was interviewed via telephone on May
14, 2024. He stated Youth A was placed in their independent
living program on March 29, 2024. He stated they were contacted
about placement and conducted an interview with Youth A and the
agency determined she would be appropriate for their program.
PM stated the agency conducts an interview with youth to
determine if they are a good fit. After that they set up a conference
with the referring agency to discuss the transfer. They request
specific documentation from the referring agency to review youth’s
history, background information and needs. He stated Youth A
was briefly in an independent living placement through another
agency and Youth A was transferred to them due to that agency
closing.
PM stated they were aware Youth A had human trafficking in her
history as well as a history of going AWOL, but she has not shown
any concerns and has been following the rules of their program
and adjusted well. He stated they were also aware of mental
health needs and arranged for Youth A to complete an intake with
2

Genesse Health System a few weeks ago. Foster Care Worker
(FCW) assisted her with obtaining a Bridge card and is working on
obtaining an ID. PM stated the only concern regarding Youth A
since she has been in their program is she used marijuana when
she first entered independent living. He stated they have not
received any reports or concerns from any of the other youth in
the home. He stated they have not been aware of any concerns
regarding substance abuse, aggressive behaviors, mental health
needs, or any threats regarding firearms or criminal activity.
After being notified of the allegations, FCW conducted a home
visit to check for self-harming behaviors and safety plan. Youth A
indicated her ex-boyfriend is the individual who has been making
the allegations.
Independent Living (IL) House Supervisor was interviewed
via telephone on May 15, 2024. She stated Youth A moved in on
March 29, 2024. During the initial interview with Youth A prior to
accepting her into the program her previous FCW disclosed she
had issues with going AWOL in the past. There were never
concerns reported regrading Youth A having any history of self-
harming behavior or substance abuse issues. She stated Youth A
has done well since she has been in their IL program.
Foster Care Worker (FCW) was interviewed via telephone on
May 17, 2024. She stated she has been Youth A’s assigned
caseworker since she moved into the independent living house on
March 29, 2024. She stated she has never had any suspicion
regarding any of the reported allegations. FCW stated they did
catch her smoking marijuana in her bedroom but nothing besides
that incident. None of the other youth in the home have made any
complaints against her. She stated Youth A reported the
complaints are coming from her ex-boyfriend.
Upon receiving the concerns FCW had a detailed conversation
with Youth A. She stated she has not noted any mental health
concerns or substance abuse concerns. The agency is not aware
of any aggressive or threatening behaviors. She stated Youth A
has been doing well and has good goals for her future.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on May 23, 2024. She
stated she is positive her ex-boyfriend made false allegations
indicating she was self-harming, using substances and aggressive
towards other youth in the home. She stated law enforcement
came to the IL house and checked her out and indicated she was
fine. Youth A stated she does not have any marks on her body
3

that were the result of self-harm. She clarified at one time she did
self-harm but that was a long time ago. She stated she offered to
submit to a drug screen as well and her room has been searched
a couple of times. She acknowledged she smokes marijuana on
occasion but that is the extent of her substance use.
She was read all of the allegations in the complaints and again
denied any of them were true and stated her ex-boyfriend has
been harassing her. She stated she is working with FCW to obtain
a personal protection order.
Documents Reviewed:
• IL contract.
• IL handbook (includes policies/procedures and program
statement). Eligibility requirements for IL program include,
in part, youth must demonstrate emotional and intellectual
maturity and possess physical ability for self-care,
demonstrate an increased need for supervision (IL Plus)
and remain in school and/or work at least halftime.
• Referral packet – Referral packet notes Youth A has a
history of going AWOL and communicating with older adult
males.
• January 25, 2024, PATP: Youth A is using whippets. AWOL
during the reporting period but has kept in touch through
text messages and phone calls. Youth able to live
independently.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews there is no indication Youth A has abused substances,
engaged in self-harming behavior or shown aggression toward
staff or other residents since moving into the independent living
house on March 29, 2024.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section • (1) An agency shall require a staff member who has
Description ongoing contact with children or parents to be a person
who has the ability, experience, education, and training to
perform the duties assigned.
4

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A has been using illegal substances such as cocaine, pills,
opioids, and marijuana. Youth A is also suicidal and has cuts all
over their arms from self-harming. Youth reports having a plan for
suicide. Youth A also has stopped eating. There is a concern the
agency is not responding appropriately.
Investigation The Complainant was anonymous.
Chief Administrator (CA) was advised of the complaint via email
on May 7, 2024, and did not have additional information to add.
Program Manager (PM) was interviewed via telephone on May
14, 2024. He stated Youth A was placed in their independent
living program on March 29, 2024. He stated the agency has not
had any concerns regarding Youth A. Foster Care Worker (FCW)
has been diligently working on services for her.
PM stated they were aware Youth A had human trafficking in her
history as well as a history of going AWOL, but she has not shown
any concerns and has been following the rules of their program
and adjusted well. He stated they were also aware of mental
health needs and arranged for Youth A to complete an intake with
Genesse Health System a few weeks ago. FCW assisted her with
obtaining a Bridge card and is working on obtaining an ID. PM
stated the only concern regarding Youth A since she has been in
their program is she used marijuana when she first entered
independent living. He stated they have not received any reports
or concerns from any of the other youth in the home. He stated
they have not been aware of any concerns regarding substance
abuse, aggressive behaviors, mental health needs, or any threats
regarding firearms or criminal activity.
After being notified of the allegations, FCW conducted a home
visit to check for self-harming behaviors and safety plan. Youth A
indicated her ex-boyfriend is the individual who has been making
the allegations.
IL house supervisor was interviewed via telephone on May
15, 2024. She stated there is staff present at the house from
3:00pm-7:00am per their contract but there are many times
additional staff are in and out during the non-staff hours. She
stated Youth A moved in on March 29, 2024.
IL house supervisor indicated she spoke with Youth A upon
receiving the allegations. She stated Youth A reported normal
5

stressors of attempting to find employment, but nothing related to
the concerns that were reported. There have not been any
suspicions that Youth A is using substances. She viewed Youth
A’s arms and did not notice any marks that indicated she was self-
harming. None of the other youth in the home have reported any
concerns regarding Youth A. If a serious concern is reported the
agency will complete an incident report. There have not been any
incident reports completed as a result of concerns or complaints
reported due to Youth A. She stated staff will conduct a room
check if they have a reason to. She stated FCW completed a
room check after receiving the initial complaint and she also
completed a room check on Youth A’s room on May 8, 2024, and
there was nothing observed that was concerning.
IL house supervisor stated Youth A is aware of the concerns that
have been reported. Youth A stated the complaints are coming
from her ex-boyfriend. IL house supervisor stated she has
overheard conversations between the two of them in the past and
indicated it is not a healthy relationship.
Foster care worker (FCW) was interviewed via telephone on
May 17, 2024. She stated she has been Youth A’s assigned
caseworker since she moved into the independent living house on
March 29, 2024. She stated she has never had any suspicion
regarding any of the reported allegations. FCW stated they did
catch her smoking marijuana in her bedroom but nothing besides
that incident. None of the other youth in the home have made any
complaints against her. She stated the agency will complete an
incident report if there is concerning behavior observed or
reported. There has been one incident report regarding Youth A
concerning her smoking in her bedroom with another youth but
nothing other than that.
FCW stated she attended an intake at DHS with Youth A the day
prior and did not notice any marks on her arms. She stated Youth
A reported the complaints are coming from her ex-boyfriend. FCW
is encouraging Youth A to block her ex-boyfriend on her phone
and social media and pursue a personal protection order.
Upon receiving the concerns FCW had a detailed conversation
with Youth A. She stated she has not noted any mental health
concerns or substance abuse concerns. The agency is not aware
of any aggressive or threatening behaviors. She stated Youth A
has been doing really well and has good goals for her future.
FCW assisted Youth A in obtaining behavioral health services.
6

FCW conducted two separate room checks on May 13, 2024, and
May 16, 2024, and there was nothing concerning noted.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on May 23, 2024. She
stated she is positive her ex-boyfriend made false allegations
indicating she was self-harming, using substances and aggressive
towards other youth in the home. She stated law enforcement
came to the IL house and checked her out and indicated she was
fine. Youth A stated she does not have any marks on her body
that were the result of self-harm. She clarified at one time she did
self-harm but that was a long time ago. Youth A stated she is not
suicidal, and her appetite is normal.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A’s MISCAWIS case file:
• May 6, 2024, SWC: FCW contacted Youth A upon
receiving allegations. Youth A stated none of the
allegations are true and her ex-boyfriend reported them due
to her no longer having contact with him.
• May 7, 2024, SWC: FCW conducted a face-to-face visit
with Youth A at the IL house. No concerns were noted.
• May 9, 2024, SWC: FCW conducted a face-to-face visit
with Youth A at the IL house. No concerns were noted.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance. Based on review of Youth A’s
MISACWIS case file as well as staff and youth interviews there is
nothing indicating the concerns regarding Youth A’s behaviors are
accurate. However, upon being notified of the concerns the
agency responded appropriately.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
